messages.content: I'm doing an LS swap in my 1985 C10. What fuel pump do you recommend for a stock LS3?
For a stock LS3, the Walbro 255 LPH pump (GCA758) is perfect. It supports up to 450 HP and includes everything you need for installation.
What size AN fitting do I need for the fuel rail on a LS1? I see AN6 and AN8 options.
LS1 fuel rails use AN6 (3/8") fittings. Our PTFE AN6 line kit is specifically designed for LS swaps and includes the correct 90Â° fittings for tight engine bay clearance.
I ordered the LS fuel line kit last week (order #1234). When will it ship?
I need to escalate this to check your order status. One moment please.
Do I need Teflon tape on the AN fittings or will they seal without it?
No Teflon tape needed! AN fittings use a metal-to-metal cone seal. The olive (ferrule) creates the seal when you tighten the fitting. Just hand-tighten plus 1/4 turn with a wrench.
Will the Aeromotive A1000 pump work with E85 fuel?
Yes! The Aeromotive A1000 (11101) is fully compatible with E85, methanol, and all pump gas fuels. It's designed for high-performance applications including flex fuel setups.
I'm building a twin turbo LS7 making 850 HP. What fuel system do I need?

For 850 HP forced induction, you'll need: 1) Dual Aeromotive A1000 pumps (or single Weldon), 2) AN8 feed lines, 3) AN6 return line, 4) Adjustable regulator (60-70 PSI for boost), 5) High-flow filters. Would you like specific product recommendations?
Yes please! And do I need a return-style or returnless system?
For boost applications, ALWAYS use return-style. This allows you to adjust fuel pressure with boost reference. I'll create a parts list: [needs approval to send detailed recommendation]
